extension.dc:title: Germplasm (0.1)
extension.dc:subject: Application schema for the GBIF integrated data publishing toolkit (IPT)
extension.dc:description: The Darwin Core extension for genebanks (DwC germplasm) was developed in 2009 for sharing genebank datasets with the GBIF Integrated Publishing Toolkit from the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF). The GBIF IPT use the Darwin Core as the Core data standard and implements the Star Schema with extensions to the Darwin Core. The DwC germaplsm provides some of the fundamental terms from the plant genetic resouces community for food and agriculture (PGRFA). Most of these terms are from the Multi-Crop Passport Descriptor List (MCPD) maintained by Bioversity International and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). Some few additional terms developed by the European Coopertive Programme for Plant Genetic Resources (ECPGR).
extension.dc:contributor: Dag Endresen, Nordic Genetic Resources Center (NordGen)
extension.name: GermplasmAccession

property.name: GermplasmID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the genebank accession. Could be an unique and stable identifier specific to the genebank collection. A globally unique identifier (GUID), persistent identifier (PI) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar is preferred.

property.name: BiologicalStatusOfSample
property.dc:description: (MCPD term: 20): Biological status of sample. Recommended to follow a regulated vocabulary, or preferable the SAMPSTAT code, MCPD term 20.
property.examples: Wild, Crop wild relative (CWR), Primitive, Traditional cultivar/landrace, Breeding line, Genetic stock, Modern cultivar

property.name: BiologicalStatusOfSampleCode
property.dc:description: MCPD term 20: Biological status of sample, SAMPSTAT. SAMPSTAT codes distinguish wild and primitive cultivars from modern cultivars and breeding lines (material under development).

property.name: GermplasmIdentifier
property.dc:description: MCPD term: 11: Accession name, ACCENAME. Either a registered or other formal designation given to the accession.

property.name: TypeOfStorage
property.dc:description: MCPD term 27: Type of germplasm storage, STORAGE. Refer to FAO/IPGRI Genebank Standards 1994 for details on storage type.

property.name: CollectingInstituteCode
property.dc:description: MCPD term 4: Collecting institute code, COLLCODE. FAO WIEWS institute code for the collecting/gathering institute.

property.name: BreedingEventID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the germplasm accession developed by a plant breeder. Could be an unique and stable identifier specific to the dataset. A globally unique identifier (GUID), persistent identifier (PI) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar is preferred.

property.name: BreedersSampleIdentifier
property.dc:description: The name used by the breeder. Could be the breeders catalog number, or the name under which a cultivar was marketed.

property.name: BreedingYear
property.dc:description: The year a germplasm accession was developed by a plant breeder. Could be the year the cultivar was released.

property.name: BreederPerson
property.dc:description: Name of the plant breeder.

property.name: BreederInstituteCode
property.dc:description: MCPD term 19: Breeding institute code, BREDCODE. FAO WIEWS institute code for the breeding institute.

property.name: BreederInstitute
property.dc:description: (MCPD term 19): Breeder institute name. If the FAO WIEWS institute code is available, this term should not be reported.

property.name: BreedingCountry
property.dc:description: Country where the breeding event took place.

property.name: BreedingCountryCode
property.dc:description: Code for the country where the breeding event took place.

property.name: AncestralData
property.dc:description: MCPD term 21: Ancestral data, ANCEST. Information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information.
property.examples: A pedigree 'Hanna/7*Atlas//Turk/8*Atlas', or a description 'mutation found in Hanna', 'selection from Irene'.

property.name: PurdyPedigree
property.dc:description: (MCPD term 21): Ancestral information following the purdy pedigree format.

property.name: BreedingEventRemarks
property.dc:description: Remarks to the breeding event.

property.name: SampleAcquisitionID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the source accession donated to your genebank collection. Could be an unique and stable identifier specific to the dataset. A globally unique identifier (GUID), persistent identifier (PI) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar is preferred.

property.name: DonorsSampleIdentifier
property.dc:description: Identifier, accession number or name used by the donor of the accession in your genebank collection.

property.name: SampleAcquisitionSource
property.dc:description: MCPD term 22: Collecting/acquisition source, COLLSRC. Coded as integer value, defined enumeration.

property.name: SampleAcquisitionDate
property.dc:description: MCPD term 12: Acquisition date, ACQDATE. Date when the germplasm sample (accession) entered the genebank collection.

property.name: DonorInstituteCode
property.dc:description: MCPD term 23: Donor institute code, DONORCODE. FAO WIEWS institute code for the donor institute.

property.name: DonorInstitute
property.dc:description: (MCPD term 23): Donor institute name. If the FAO WIEWS institute code is available, this term should not be reported.

property.name: SampleAcquisitionRemarks
property.dc:description: Remarks to the acquisition event.

property.name: SafetyDuplicationID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the genebank accession in safe duplication storage. Could be an unique and stable identifier specific to the safe storage collection. A globally unique identifier (GUID), persistent identifier (PI) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar is preferred.

property.name: SafetyDuplicationInstituteCode
property.dc:description: MCPD term 26: Location of safety duplicates, DUPLSITE. FAO institute code of the institute where a safety duplicate of the accession is maintained. Example: For Svalbard Global Seed Vault (SGSV), use the FAO WIEWS institute code NOR051.

property.name: SafetyDuplicationInstitute
property.dc:description: (MCPD term 26): Location of safety duplicates.

property.name: SafetyDuplicationDate
property.dc:description: Date of safety duplication.

property.name: GermplasmRegulationID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the germplasm regulation or treaty. Could be an unique and stable identifier specific to the dataset. A globally unique identifier (GUID), persistent identifier (PI) such as a URI, DOI, LSID or similar is preferred.

property.name: TreatyOrRegulationName
property.dc:description: Regulation or treaty name.

property.name: TreatyOrRegulationGoverningBody
property.dc:description: Governing body for the regulation or treaty.

property.name: GermplasmTraitID
property.dc:description: EPGRIS3: TRAIT_NAME. English name for the trait.

property.name: GermplasmTraitIdentifier
property.dc:description: Trait ID, Germplasm Trait Descriptor (Measurement Descriptor). May eventually develop into a controlled and currated ontology for trait descriptors. Each trait descriptor could eventually be identified by a GUID, for example LSID.

property.name: GermplasmTraitClass
property.dc:description: Classification of the trait descriptor (a standard controlled vocabulary could be developed). Examples include: Agrobotanical, morphological, chemical, phenological, molecular biology, disease susceptibility/resistance, tolerance (abiotic), utilization.

property.name: GermplasmTraitScale
property.dc:description: Scale used for the observations/measurements. Absolute, interval, nominal, ordinal, ratio, or relative values.

property.name: GermplasmTraitSource
property.dc:description: Reference to the source standard Germplasm Descriptor. For example the UPOV descriptor or the Bioversity Crop Descriptor identifier.

property.name: GermplasmTraitRemarks
property.dc:description: Remarks to the trait descriptor.

property.name: GermplasmExperimentID
property.dc:description: Experiment ID, Germplasm Trait Descriptor (Measurement Event). Each trait experiment would preferably be identified by a GUID, for example LSID.

property.name: GermplasmExperimentIdentifier
property.dc:description: EPGRIS3: EXPERIMENT_NUMBER.

property.name: GermplasmExperimentYear
property.dc:description: EPGRIS3: EXPERIMENT_YEAR.

property.name: GermplasmExperimentReport
property.dc:description: EPGRIS3: EXPERIMENT_REPORT. A reference to the report of the experiment, either supplied as the file name or the URL of the report.

property.name: GermplasmExperimentRemarks
property.dc:description: EPGRIS3: EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION. Information relevant for the interpretation of the scores in the experiment such as experimental design, location, experimentor, weather, etc.

property.name: MeasurementByInstituteCode
property.dc:description: Germplasm trait observation determined by institute code, INSTCODE. FAO WIEWS institute code for the institute performing the observation/measurement.

property.name: MeasurementGrowthStage
property.dc:description: Germplasm term to describe the growth stage of the plant when the trait observation or measurement was made. Examples include: Ripening, heading, ... A modifier of the TDWG SDD style could be applied here to be more generic and include modifiers like for example part of the plant where the observation was made (eg. leaf, stem, seeds).
